clinical_study.official_title: An Evaluation of the Safety and Performance of the Aortix System for Intra-Aortic Mechanical Circulatory Support in Patients With Cardiorenal Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: The Aortix CRS Pilot Study: An Evaluation of the Safety and Performance of the Aortix System for Intra-Aortic Mechanical Circulatory Support in Patients with Cardiorenal Syndrome

detailed_description.textblock: The study is a prospective, multi-center, non-randomized feasibility study to evaluate the safety and performance of the Aortix System in patients hospitalized with acute decompensated heart failure (ADHF) and worsening renal function refractory to medical management with persistent congestion. The Aortix system consists of the Aortix Delivery System, Introducer Set, the Aortix Pump, the Aortix Control System, and the Aortix Retrieval System.

primary_outcome.description: Rate of Occurrence of Serious Adverse Events (rate will be calculated and reported)
Rate of Occurrence of Serious Procedure Related Adverse Events (rate will be calculated and reported)
Deployment and retrieval procedures success rates (rates will be calculated and reported)
Rate of occurrence of ADS, ARS and pump device-related adverse events (includes device malfunctions) (rate will be calculated and reported)
Clinically significant decongestion as measured by the PA catheter. Decrease in CVP or PCWP of > 20%.

Change in Urine Output Assessed as the hourly rate of urine output before pump placed vs hourly rate of urine output over the Aortix therapy period (until congestion target met or therapy deemed ineffective)
Decrease in BNP or NT-pro-BNP by 20% (pre-implant vs when congestion target is met or therapy deemed ineffective)

arm_group.description: Aortix Pump, Aortix Delivery System, Introducer Set, Aortix Control System, Aortix Retrieval System

intervention.description: Aortix is a circulatory support device for chronic heart failure patients on medical management who have been hospitalized for acute decompensated heart failure (ADHF) with worsening renal function.
